summary: This bill, the Seized Iranian Arms Transfer Authorization Act of 2025, authorizes the President to treat weapons and materiel seized from Iran en route to the Houthis in Yemen as U.S. stocks. It grants the President drawdown authority to provide these resources to foreign partners, amending the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The bill mandates reports to Congress detailing the exercise of this authority, including inventories of seized and distributed materiel. The term "appropriate committees of Congress" is defined.
